name: Firemage
description: Firemages are fascinated by fire. They love the way it flickers and dances; they excel at creating flames, throwing fire, and delight in creating and controlling infernos and conflagrations. Firemages can sometimes be identified by a slight sent of sulfur.

exploits.name: Fiery affinity
exploits.description: Your focus on fire grants you +1d6 to any attribute which interacts with fire or heat.

exploits.name: Firebolt
exploits.description: You can throw a bolt of fire as a single ranged attack (using your MAG attribute) which has a range increment of 30' and does 2d6 fire damage.

exploits.name: Firebolt, greater
exploits.description: Your Firebolt's damage increases to 3d6 fire.

exploits.name: Fire immunity
exploits.description: You become completely immune to fire or heat damage. Your vulnerability to cold, however, increases to 2d6.

exploits.name: Fire resistance
exploits.description: You permanently gain SOAK 5 (fire). However, you also suffer Vulnerability (1d6) to cold.

exploits.name: Firesculptor
exploits.description: You can 'sculpt' fire easily; any non-magical flame within 30' can be shaped or enlarged as a single action and a mere effort of will as long as it remains within 30' (things outside can catch fire as normal, but you have no control over them).

exploits.name: Flaming aura
exploits.description: You gain an aura (based on your size as normal) of flame and heat, although you may suppress it easily. Creatures entering or starting a turn in this aura take 2d6 fire damage.

exploits.name: Flaming touch
exploits.description: Your touch becomes hot enough to injure others, causing an additional 1d6 of heat damage beyond your natural damage.

exploits.name: Sticky fire
exploits.description: Every time you damage a foe with fire, they gain the Burning condition.
